basics.name: Parham Saremi
basics.label: MSc Student at Mila | McGill University
basics.summary: Graduate student at Mila and McGill University supervised by Prof. Tal Arbel, with research interests in computer vision, generative modeling, and medical imaging.

work.name: Mila - Quebec Artificial Intelligence Institute
work.summary: Conducting research in medical imaging and generative modeling under the supervision of Prof. Tal Arbel.
highlights: Working on Diffusion Models for explainability and uncertainty quantification in medical images.

work.name: ETH Zürich – AIT Lab
work.summary: Worked as a research intern on Human-Object Interaction and 3D reconstruction.
highlights: Designed and implemented pipelines to generate 3D human and object models from single images while reasoning about their interaction.
Used the decoder of a pre-trained VQ-VAE model to generate object meshes from images.

work.name: Node Effect
work.summary: Worked as a .Net developer and contributed to C# and F# open-source projects.
highlights: Developed a MAUI-based application (C#) and contributed to the MAUI Linux project.

work.name: EPFL – VITA Lab
work.summary: Worekd as a researh intern on Human Pose Forecasting.
highlights: Developed and maintained UnPOSed, an open-source toolbox for forecasting a sequence of human pose in future.
Designed and evaluated a method for human motion prediction that improved results of various SOTA models by 2-5% across multiple datasets.

work.name: University of California Irvine & Sharif University of Technology
work.summary: Joint reserach project between UCI and Sharif University of Technology for my B.Sc. thesis.
highlights: Worked with vision-language models, Transforemrs, and Graph Neural Networks.
Designed and developed a multimodal model using GNNs and Transformers to predict cuisine using ingredient information and recipes.

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: Investigated and experimented with new methods for the verification of Neural Networks.
